p: Furthermore in recent decades, infection control has focused essentially in minimizing nosocomial transmission, albeit with partial success [41]â€“ [43]. In particular, a study by Tobin et al. [42] revealed a general lack of knowledge of barrier nursing among health workers in rural areas. This problem is expected to be even more persistent among non-professionals, suggesting that control measures have not significantly changed since LF was discovered. Hence despite these data sets being collected at quite different points in time, health-care practices have not changed meaningfully over this time period.
